ETYMOLOGY: From Old English ānes ('once, at one time'), genitive of ān ('one'). The final -s became -ce in Middle English, influenced by words like 'twice'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An adverb modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb, indicating manner, place, time, or degree.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: On one occasion only; a single time.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An adverb modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb, indicating manner, place, time, or degree.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: At some time in the past; formerly.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A conjunction is a word used to connect clauses or sentences or to coordinate words in the same clause.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Once you start, you'll find it hard to stop.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 一旦你开始，你就会发现很难停下来。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An adverb modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb, indicating manner, place, time, or degree.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to denote frequency, meaning 'one time in every specified period'.
